title: How to Play Work at a Pizza Place on Roblox

steps.headline: Wait for a customer to walk to the counter.
steps.description: Customers are NPCs (Non-Playable Characters) or players in the server. They will stand behind the cash register waiting to be attended to.

steps.headline: Talk to the customer behind the counter.
steps.description: To talk to NPC customers, you must click the question mark floating above their head or press the E key. Once clicked, you have the ability to choose three different sentences. Players have to physically type what they want in the chat, so keep your chat tab open. Remember that, when in Advanced Cashier mode, two of the sentences are rude and immature. If you choose the wrong one, the NPC will respond negatively and leave the restaurant. Choose the answer that is the most polite, welcoming, and mature. Think carefully and wisely about what answer you choose.

steps.headline: Click on the correct order using the keypad on top of the counter.
steps.description: When you do so, the NPC will reply kindly. Just like when you choose the wrong answer when talking to the NPC, when you click on the wrong order, the NPC will respond with an angry and insulting comment and leave the restaurant. Slowly, choose the correct order. Once you clicked on the correct order, the NPC will respond positively, then take a seat at a table. Their order will now show up on the board in the kitchen.

steps.headline: Look at the board at the back of the kitchen.
steps.description: When the Cashier makes a successful order, the order will automatically appear on the board. It will show either a can of Bloxly soda, cheese pizza, sausage pizza, or pepperoni pizza. Cashiers having successful orders is crucial for the cook's job. No orders means the cook has nothing to do, and everyone else will receive little money. There's no "me" in pizza!

steps.headline: Collect the materials for the order.
steps.description: When making a pizza, the first step is getting dough from the conveyor belt on the left and placing it on the table. If Bloxly is ordered, take a can from the fridge and send it through the conveyor on the right. You can move items by clicking and dragging them. Bloxly is sent through the conveyor belt instead of table since it does not require any preparation.

steps.headline: Add ingredients to the dough.
steps.description: Once you place the dough on the table, you need to place the tomato sauce and cheese onto the dough. Then you will place either pepperoni or sausage toppings on the pizza, depending on the order. Keep pizzas off the floor! Bugs will attract to it if you leave it there.

steps.headline: Put the pizza in the oven.
steps.description: Now that all the ingredients are on, time to cook it! On the right side is a wall of ovens, open one of the doors, place the pizza inside, and close the door. When the pizza is done, the meter will turn green and you will hear a ding. Pay close attention to the meter! If you cook the pizza too long it will catch on fire! The alarm will sound and the meter will turn red. Grab the fire extinguisher by the door, extinguish the fire, and throw away the pizza. The oven is not a house! Even if it might look inviting, if the door happens to close on you along the way... you're toast.

steps.headline: Send the pizza to the boxing station.
steps.description: After opening the door, take the pizza out of the oven and drag it over to the conveyor to the left of the ovens. If the pizza is missing ingredients, has bugs, or is burnt it will be rejected and tossed away. Pizzas might get stuck if you try to send more than pizza through at once.

steps.headline: Wait for a pizza to come into where the pizzas for boxing comes in.
steps.description: It should arrive on a conveyor belt.

steps.headline: Grab a pizza box and put the pizza in one of the boxes.
steps.description: Click on it to close it.

steps.headline: Put the pizza box on the conveyor belt.
steps.description: As soon as you finish doing that, the pizza box with the pizza in it should go on the table near the Garage where the supplier comes in.

steps.headline: Grab the pizzas.
steps.description: This can be done easily when standing on them if there are many boxes to collect.

steps.headline: Look at the bottom of the screen; you should see a number like B3.
steps.description: This is the house number you need to bring it to.

steps.headline: Go out of the pizza store into one of the delivery cars, if available.
Drive the car to the mailbox corresponding with the number on the pizza at the bottom of your screen.
Touch the door of the mailbox.
steps.description: You should hear a ding dong noise, and the door should open. If you chose the wrong mailbox, the person will say something along the lines of "I didn't order any pizza." If you chose the right mailbox, the person will say something like "I am going to devour this!!"

steps.headline: Walk or drive to the building at the opposite end of the map.
steps.description: This building should have trucks inside or nearby. Inside the building, there should be an array of colourful buttons and a graph that shows the number of supplies at the pizza restaurant.

steps.headline: Step on the buttons.
steps.description: A cube that is the same color as the button will pop up on a nearby conveyor belt. Depending on the item, these cubes represent 2-5 portions. Don't stand on one button for too long, though, as cubes will flood out onto the conveyor.

steps.headline: Drag the boxes into the back of your truck.
steps.description: To do this, drag your mouse (Or your finger if on a mobile device) to the truck.

steps.headline: Drive the truck to the room with a gray metal door in Builder Brother's Pizza.
steps.description: Once inside, drag the cubes to the conveyor belt and watch them get sucked into the hopper. Drive carefully, as you don't want to drop half of your cubes. No matter how tempting that conveyor belt may seem, don't walk on it. Your character will die if they get sucked into the hopper.

text: Working as a Cashier Wait for a customer to walk to the counter. Customers are NPCs (Non-Playable Characters) or players in the server. They will stand behind the cash register waiting to be attended to. Talk to the customer behind the counter. To talk to NPC customers, you must click the question mark floating above their head or press the E key. Once clicked, you have the ability to choose three different sentences. Players have to physically type what they want in the chat, so keep your chat tab open. Remember that, when in Advanced Cashier mode, two of the sentences are rude and immature. If you choose the wrong one, the NPC will respond negatively and leave the restaurant. Choose the answer that is the most polite, welcoming, and mature. Think carefully and wisely about what answer you choose. Click on the correct order using the keypad on top of the counter. When you do so, the NPC will reply kindly. Just like when you choose the wrong answer when talking to the NPC, when you click on the wrong order, the NPC will respond with an angry and insulting comment and leave the restaurant. Slowly, choose the correct order. Once you clicked on the correct order, the NPC will respond positively, then take a seat at a table. Their order will now show up on the board in the kitchen. Working as a Cook Look at the board at the back of the kitchen. When the Cashier makes a successful order, the order will automatically appear on the board. It will show either a can of Bloxly soda, cheese pizza, sausage pizza, or pepperoni pizza. Cashiers having successful orders is crucial for the cook's job. No orders means the cook has nothing to do, and everyone else will receive little money. There's no "me" in pizza! Collect the materials for the order. When making a pizza, the first step is getting dough from the conveyor belt on the left and placing it on the table. If Bloxly is ordered, take a can from the fridge and send it through the conveyor on the right. You can move items by clicking and dragging them. Bloxly is sent through the conveyor belt instead of table since it does not require any preparation. Add ingredients to the dough. Once you place the dough on the table, you need to place the tomato sauce and cheese onto the dough. Then you will place either pepperoni or sausage toppings on the pizza, depending on the order. Keep pizzas off the floor! Bugs will attract to it if you leave it there. Put the pizza in the oven. Now that all the ingredients are on, time to cook it! On the right side is a wall of ovens, open one of the doors, place the pizza inside, and close the door. When the pizza is done, the meter will turn green and you will hear a ding. Pay close attention to the meter! If you cook the pizza too long it will catch on fire! The alarm will sound and the meter will turn red. Grab the fire extinguisher by the door, extinguish the fire, and throw away the pizza. The oven is not a house! Even if it might look inviting, if the door happens to close on you along the way... you're toast. Send the pizza to the boxing station. After opening the door, take the pizza out of the oven and drag it over to the conveyor to the left of the ovens. If the pizza is missing ingredients, has bugs, or is burnt it will be rejected and tossed away. Pizzas might get stuck if you try to send more than pizza through at once. Working as a Pizza Boxer Wait for a pizza to come into where the pizzas for boxing comes in. It should arrive on a conveyor belt. Grab a pizza box and put the pizza in one of the boxes. Click on it to close it. Put the pizza box on the conveyor belt. As soon as you finish doing that, the pizza box with the pizza in it should go on the table near the Garage where the supplier comes in. Working as a Delivery Person Grab the pizzas. This can be done easily when standing on them if there are many boxes to collect. Look at the bottom of the screen; you should see a number like B3. This is the house number you need to bring it to. Go out of the pizza store into one of the delivery cars, if available.  Drive the car to the mailbox corresponding with the number on the pizza at the bottom of your screen.  Touch the door of the mailbox. You should hear a ding dong noise, and the door should open. If you chose the wrong mailbox, the person will say something along the lines of "I didn't order any pizza." If you chose the right mailbox, the person will say something like "I am going to devour this!!" Working as a Supplier Walk or drive to the building at the opposite end of the map. This building should have trucks inside or nearby. Inside the building, there should be an array of colourful buttons and a graph that shows the number of supplies at the pizza restaurant. Step on the buttons. A cube that is the same color as the button will pop up on a nearby conveyor belt. Depending on the item, these cubes represent 2-5 portions. Don't stand on one button for too long, though, as cubes will flood out onto the conveyor. Drag the boxes into the back of your truck. To do this, drag your mouse (Or your finger if on a mobile device) to the truck. Drive the truck to the room with a gray metal door in Builder Brother's Pizza. Once inside, drag the cubes to the conveyor belt and watch them get sucked into the hopper. Drive carefully, as you don't want to drop half of your cubes. No matter how tempting that conveyor belt may seem, don't walk on it. Your character will die if they get sucked into the hopper.
